turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of rail transport in Belgium.
turn.1: What role did the Belgians play in the history of rail transport?
turn.2: History of rail transport in Belgium  Belgium was heavily involved in the early development of railway transport.
turn.3: What are some of the things they did?
turn.4: Belgium was the second country in Europe, after Great Britain, to open a railway and produce locomotives.
turn.6: The first line, between the cities of Brussels and Mechelen opened in 1835.
turn.7: Did they have any other accomplishments?
turn.8: Belgium was the first state in Europe to create a national railway network and the first to possess a nationalised railway system.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The network expanded fast as Belgium industrialised, and by the early 20th century was increasingly under state-control.
turn.12: The nationalised railways, under the umbrella organisation National Railway Company of Belgium (NMBS/SNCB), retained their monopoly until liberalisation in the 2000s.
